Jun 29, 2007 PowerMarketers Industry Publications



Restructuring and Deregulation in the United States: Reflections On A Paced, But Still Maturing, Market (UtiliPoint.com - Jun. 29, 2007)



UtiliPoint.com - Jun. 29, 2007 - From within the sector, it would be difficult to find a professional that does not know that the electric power industry is evolving from a highly regulated, monopolistic regime to a less regulated system and competitive market.

Natural Gas Intelligence summudles for Jun. 29, 2007

Green Energy Fuels Utilities (EnergyBiz Insider - Jun. 29, 2007) 



EnergyBiz Insider - Jun. 29, 2007 - Utilities like green energy. They also like the tax benefits that come with providing them.

NATIONAL NEWS






Consultant challenges MEA's plant projections



Jun. 29--PALMER -- Matanuska Electric Association cites the unpredictable future of natural gas prices in the Cook Inlet as one reason coal is an attractive fuel for a 100-megawatt power plant it plans to bring online in 2015.  Utility and pipeline consultant Mark Foster, at a recent public meeting about the cost of coal, warned attendees that by choosing coal, MEA could kill a project to ship ...


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Pa. salt cavern will store gas: Dominion tries new way to contain fuel, costing $500 million-$700 million



Jun. 29--Dominion Resources Inc. is looking to store natural gas in a new spot -- salt caverns.  The Richmond-based energy company will spend between $500 and $700 million to create salt caverns and build a salt refinery in Tioga County, Pa. The project will expand Dominion's natural gas storage capacity by as much as 50 billion cubic feet, enough to power about 500,000 homes for a year.


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Energy bill OK'd by state Senate



Jun. 29--RALEIGH -- North Carolina could be the first state in the Southeast to require its power companies to generate a substantial amount of electricity from renewable sources, under a measure overwhelmingly endorsed Thursday by the Senate.  The legislation -- which has been pushed for years by environmental groups -- would require that solar energy, animal waste and other renewable sources ...


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Central Illinois 'hotbed' for wind energy



Jun. 29--BLOOMINGTON -- The wind-energy industry is fast expanding in Central Illinois, but one absentee on the bandwagon is the main company that supplies the area with power.  With electric rates in legislative limbo, Ameren Corp. has yet to purchase wind energy for its Illinois subsidiaries, AmerenIP, AmerenCILCO and AmerenCIPS. Still, the St. Louis-based utility applied with energy regulators ...


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Amendment may aid Toledo's quest for energy



Jun. 29--COLUMBUS -- Toledo residents may have moved closer to benefiting from steam power generated by the proposed $800 million FDS Coke Plant.  Under an amendment added to Ohio's just-passed state budget, the project could qualify for federal tax-exempt financing if it sells energy generated by the plant to a tax-exempt municipal utility rather than to FirstEnergy Corp.


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Firm seeks new electric lines



Jun. 29--A Michigan company that builds electric transmission lines and attained utility status in Kansas this month has its sights on Oklahoma, and may create competition for utilities.  ITC Great Plains President Carl Huslig and other company representatives met this week with Oklahoma Deputy Secretary of Energy Bobby Wagner to express interest in building transmission lines in Oklahoma, Wagner ...


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Energy bill cited as national model



Jun. 29--The Council of State Governments has selected a measure by state Rep. Tom Sloan, R-Lawrence, as model legislation that other states should consider. House Bill 2169, which was signed into law in April, authorizes the Kansas Development Finance Authority to partner with federal agencies, including the military, to install energy conservation equipment and acquire renewable energy.


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Wasden plans energy conference: Energy experts to meet state attorneys general



Jun. 29--BOISE -- From global warming to alternative energy sources to increasing gas prices, states are facing serious energy issues, and state attorneys general need to be prepared, Idaho Attorney General Lawrence Wasden says.  Newly elected as president of the National Association of Attorneys General, Wasden has selected energy as the initiative he'll focus on during his one-year term.


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



CL&P seeks 4.6% rate increase



Jun. 29--A day after electric utilities and state regulators touted a program that would give customers credit on energy bills this fall, the Connecticut Light & Power Co. said it intends to ask for a 4.6 percent rate increase, beginning in 2008.  CL&P said today it will file a letter of intent asking the state Department of Public Utility Control to allow it to raise an additional $189 million ..


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



OGE Enogex expected to rake in capital



Jun. 28--Investment capital is expected to pour into Oklahoma once again later this year with the completion of an initial public offering for OGE Enogex Partners Limited Partnership.  Parent company OGE Energy Corp. Wednesday announced an IPO registration was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission, proposing to sell 7.5 million common units that represent 34 percent of the ownership ...


Jun 28, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Electricity relief deal closes in on $1 billion



Jun. 29--SPRINGFIELD -- After weeks of bruising negotiations, state lawmakers have squeezed a rate-relief package for electricity customers worth $950 million from major utilities, Senate Majority Leader Debbie Halvorson said Thursday. But lawmakers want to push the relief to $1 billion overall, and top legislative leaders will meet once again with utility executives from Commonwealth Edison, ...


Jun 29, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News



Pelosi supports Senate mileage bill, unveils energy independence bills



Jun. 28--WASHINGTON -- House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said today that she supports a Senate bill raising fuel economy standards to 35 miles per gallon by 2020, and declined to say whether she would block a similar proposal from coming to the House floor next month.  The California Democrat spoke at the unveiling of a package of energy bills that Democrats plan to take to the House floor next month, ...


Jun 28, 2007 Knight Ridder Tribune Business News





PSE&G To Install More Energy-Efficient Equipment



The Digital Utility  Vegetation Management  Public Service Electric and Gas Company (New Jersey) will invest in more efficient electric delivery equipment, a move expected to reduce energy use and cut carbon emissions by some 60,000 tons by the year 2020. Energy efficiency is considered the most cost-effective carbon reduction method available, reducing greenhouse gas emissions by reducing the ...


Jun 29, 2007 Transmission & Distribution World



Idaho nuke plant lures unlikely lender



Cobblestone Financial Group, in the Erie Canal town of Fairport, N.Y., has given Alternate Energy Holdings a letter of intent 'to fund 100 percent of its proposed Idaho Energy Complex' on 4,000 acres in Owyhee County near the Snake River, an official with the Idaho project said this week. According to Cobblestone's Web site, the company focuses 'on complex and troublesome commercial real estate ...


Jun 29, 2007 Idaho Statesman



NiSource to appeal $270 million punitive award after Roane decision



Click here for Part 2 of the judge's order NiSource Inc. says it will ask the state Supreme Court to overturn a $270 million punitive damages award in a natural gas royalties case after a circuit judge upheld the jury's decision. Roane Circuit Judge Tom Evans ruled Thursday that the evidence and the law did not warrant overturning either the jury's finding of fraud or the size of the award.


Jun 29, 2007 Charleston Daily Mail



Pacificorp Granted Easement to Connect New Substation



The Digital Utility  Vegetation Management  Unico, Inc., a natural resource company in the precious metals mining sector, has granted PacifiCorp an easement for a right of way to establish a connection between the existing substation adjacent to the Deer Trail Mine property and the new substation that will supply power to the Deer Trail Mine. According to the terms of the agreement, the easement ...


Jun 29, 2007 Transmission & Distribution World



Electric Bill Relief Could Be Fleeting



CL&P To Ask State For Rate Increase Remember that promised electric rate decrease? Don't worry - it's coming this Sunday, just as Connecticut Light & Power said it would. But don't get used to the lower rates. A new increase is already in the works, one that might largely negate the brand-new decrease. Connecticut Light & Power will ask regulators in a filing today to increase what ...


Jun 29, 2007 Hartford Courant



Pols wary of energy-cost plan



Pols wary of energy-cost plan By Jay FitzgeraldBoston Herald General Economics Reporter Friday, June 29, 2007 House Democrats yesterday said they have serious concerns about Gov. Deval Patricks proposal to have ratepayers subsidize utilities for lost profits and revenue due to stepped-up conservation measures. Both House Speaker Sal DiMasi and Rep. Brian Dempsey, chairman of the ...


Jun 29, 2007 Boston Herald





Chevron Pipe Line Company Announces Keystone Expansion



Chevron Pipe Line Company announced today that it plans to expand its Keystone Gas Storage facility in West Texas by an additional 2 billion cubic feet (Bcf) for a total working gas capacity of 7 Bcf. The facility's withdrawal capability is 400 million cubic feet per day (mmcf/d) and injection capability is 160 mmcf/d. The expansion is expected to increase injection capability to 200 mmcf/d.


Jun 29, 2007 PR Newswire



Nevada Power Issues RFP for Power Products



LAS VEGAS--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Nevada Power Company, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sierra Pacific Resources (NYSE:SRP), announced today that it has issued a request for proposals for energy supply, including firm energy and various tolling and other power products. The deadline to submit a proposal is on or before 9 a.m. Pacific time on Thursday, August 9, 2007.


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



Sierra Pacific Power Files Integrated Resource Plan With the Public Utilities Commission of Nevada



RENO, Nev., June 29 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Sierra Pacific Power, a wholly owned subsidiary of Sierra Pacific Resources (NYSE: SRP), today submitted to the Public Utilities Commission of Nevada an updated blueprint for serving the long-term energy needs of its electricity and natural gas customers in northern Nevada. The utility's Integrated Resource Plan (IRP) is filed every three years.


Jun 29, 2007 PR Newswire



Cities Aggregation Power Project Celebrates 100th Member



Cities Aggregation Power Project (CAPP) announced that the City of Dickinson voted Tuesday to join, becoming the 100th city in Texas to pool its demand for electricity with other CAPP member cities around Texas. After aggregating cities' electricity needs, CAPP negotiates for discounted rates that are contracted over long periods, helping municipalities achieve budget certainty -- often with ...


Jun 29, 2007 PR Newswire



SCE Proposes Final Leg of California's Largest Renewable Transmission Project



ROSEMEAD, Calif.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Southern California Edison (SCE) today applied to the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC) and the U.S. Forest Service for authorization to construct Segments 4-11 of the Tehachapi Renewable Transmission Project, a series of new and upgraded high-voltage electric transmission lines to deliver electricity from proposed new wind farms in the Tehachapi ...


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



Fitch: OGE Energy Plans for Master Limited Partnership Won't Affect Ratings



NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Fitch Ratings said Friday that OGE Energy Corp.'s (OGE Energy) plans to form a master limited partnership (MLP) will not have an immediate impact on the ratings of OGE Energy or its subsidiaries. OGE Energy, currently rated 'A' by Fitch with a Stable Rating Outlook, filed a registration statement relating to a proposed initial public offering (IPO) of common units of a ...


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



First Midwest Bancorp Announces Election of New Independent Director



The Board of Directors of First Midwest Bancorp,  The Board of Directors of First Midwest Bancorp, Inc. (NASDAQ: FMBI) today announced the election of John F. Chlebowski, Jr. as an independent director of the corporation. With the addition of Mr. Chlebowski, the First Midwest Bancorp Board has 13 directors, eleven of whom are independent.  "Our shareholders will be fortunate to have Mr. ...


Jun 28, 2007 Internet Wire



Georgia Power Requests Recovery for Environmental and Customer Investments



Georgia Power today asked the Georgia Public Service Commission (PSC) for permission to increase its base rates to recover costs for environmental programs, new generation and electric infrastructure to meet growing customer demand for electricity. If the request is approved, the average residential customer bill would increase by about 7.06 percent, or $6.67 per month.


Jun 29, 2007 PR Newswire



Namaste Solar Installs SunPower Solar Power System on Colorado Governor's Residence



DENVER, June 29 /PRNewswire-FirstCall/ -- Namaste Solar Electric and SunPower Corporation (Nasdaq: SPWR), a Silicon Valley-based manufacturer of high-efficiency solar cells, solar panels and solar systems, today announced the completed installation of a 7.4-kilowatt solar power system at the Colorado Governor's Residence in Denver using SunPower's high-efficiency solar electric panels.


Jun 29, 2007 PR Newswire



Fitch Rates Entergy Gulf States Reconstruction Funding I, LLC, Series A



NEW YORK--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Fitch rates Entergy Gulf States Reconstruction Funding I, LLC, Series A as follows: --$93,500,000 5.51% tranche A-1 'AAA'; --$121,600,000 5.79% tranche A-2 'AAA'; --$114,400,000 5.93% tranche A-3 'AAA'; The collateral securing the transition bonds consists primarily of transition property, which represents the right to collect a tariff (transition charge, or TC) from ...


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



Pepco Completes New 230-KV Lines, Improves Reliability for DC



WASHINGTON--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Pepco has placed into service two newly constructed high-voltage transmission lines that will enhance the reliability of electric service for downtown Washington and the federal government. The lines, each carrying 230,000 volts, were constructed over an 18-month period with completion in time to meet this summers peak demand period.


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



Capital Advice Engineers Solar Acquisition by Nevada-Based Private Equity Group



SCOTTSDALE, Ariz.--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Arizona-based Capital Advice llc served as advisor to Sierra Nevada Partners, Incline Village, Nev., in its acquisition of HelioPower Inc., a California-based solar energy company. Terms of the transaction were not disclosed. Capital Advice, a regional investment banking firm, will continue to spearhead Sierra Nevada Partners ongoing search for additional ...


Jun 28, 2007 Business Wire





DTE Energy Completes Sale of a Subsidiary to Atlas Energy Inc. for $1.26 Billion



DETROIT (AP) - DTE Energy Co. said Friday it closed the sale of some exploration and production properties to Atlas Energy Resources for $1.26 billion. Atlas Energy Resources, a business unit of Philadelphia-based Atlas America Inc., bought DTE's Michigan Antrim Shale which owns interests in about 2,150 natural gas wells located in Michigan's northern lower peninsula.


Jun 29, 2007 Canadian Business Magazine



Enbridge files terms for Clipper pipeline



Enbridge Inc. (ENB/TSX) announced Thursday it has filed commercial terms to its application to the National Energy Board regarding the Alberta Clipper mainline expansion project. The filing sets out tolling principles and risk sharing parameters agreed to by shippers regarding Enbridge's $2-billion Canadian section of the expansion. The terms of the tolling principles include a 45 per cent ...


Jun 29, 2007 National Post



Industry, Environmentalists Square Off Again on Power Plant Emission Upgrades



WASHINGTON (AP) - Environmentalists and electric utilities face off Friday at a hearing on an industry-favored proposal to change how the government decides when pollution controls are needed at older power plants. The proposal, released by the Environmental Protection Agency in April, is the latest twist in a long debate about requirements that utilities install expensive pollution control ...


Jun 29, 2007 Canadian Business Magazine



PG&E customers go carbon neutral



Pacific Gas and Electric Co. announced the launch of ClimateSmart, a voluntary emissions neutralizing program for its customers. The program will give customers the option to neutralize greenhouse gas emissions associated with their energy use by funding environmental projects and PG&E has signed up as the first participant. 'The launch of ClimateSmart represents a major milestone in educating ...


Jun 29, 2007 UPI



Maryland Gov. O'Malley Says He's Not Finished Looking Into Energy Costs



- 3:54 p.m. ANNAPOLIS, Md. (AP) - Gov. Martin O'Malley pledged Friday to keep looking for ways to address rising energy costs, saying state officials will explore how prices are influenced by the relationship between Baltimore Gas and Electric Co. and its parent company, Constellation Energy Group Inc. 'I intend to do everything I possibly can to get us out of the horrible situation that all ...


Jun 29, 2007 Canadian Business Magazine



Judge orders Westar to pay $3.1M for Lake's legal fees



Westar Energy Inc., will have to pay about $3.1 million in legal fees to attorneys who represented a former company executive in a criminal trial for fraud and conspiracy, a federal judge ruled Thursday. That amount is half of the $6.2 million East Coast firms billed for legal services to represent Spielas Lake, former executive vice president for Topeka-based Westar (NSYE: WR).


Jun 29, 2007 Wichita Business Journal



Colo. governor uses solar power



Namaste Solar Electric and SunPower Corp. announced the completed installation of a 7.4-kilowatt solar power system at the Colorado governor's home in Denver. The system, which is installed at the Carriage House at the historic Boettcher Mansion, is expected to generate 8,441 kilowatt-hours of electricity annually. In combination with a smaller 2.4 kilowatt system installed on the Pump House on ...


Jun 29, 2007 UPI



Major US Power Company Plans To Use Industrial Nanotech Product To Protect Public



Naples, FL - Industrial Nanotech, Inc., a global leader in nanotechnology, announced recently that a major US Power Company plans to use Industrial Nanotech's Nansulate nanotechnology based coating to provide both corrosion protection and thermal insulation of its infrastructure. The total value of the project has not yet been determined and the project is expected to be ongoing.


Jun 29, 2007 Power Online



Solar power may bring new jobs to Texas



A study says increased used of solar power could bring 123,000 new jobs to Texas during the next few decades. The report by the IC2 Institute at the University of Texas at Austin said the creation of a vibrant solar power industry could stimulate the state's economy, reduce the cost of power for consumers and minimize green-house gas emissions, the university said Friday in a news release.

UN inspectors tour North Korean nuclear facility

On Thursday IAEA officials reported that they ...

World's Largest Wind Power Developer Gets U.S. Assets



-- Spanish construction firm Acciona, the world's largest wind power developer, said June 27 it has won exclusive rights to develop 1300 megawatts (MW) of wind assets in Illinois, Iowa and Wisconsin. Acciona acquired projects from EcoEnergy, LLC, an alternative energy solutions developer and unit of The Morse Group and sees the Spanish firm shore-up expansion in North America as a long-term owner ...


Jun 29, 2007 Industry Week



Petrochemical Production in Iran Set to Soar to 20 Million Tons by March 2008



DUBLIN, Ireland--(BUSINESS WIRE)--Research and Markets (http://www.researchandmarkets.com/reports/c61036) has announced the addition of Petrochemical Industry of Iran 2007 to their offering. In a matter of few years, Iran has elevated itself to 60th in the world and 2nd largest producer and exporter of petrochemicals in the Middle East. The country produces 12 percent of the total petrochemical ...


Jun 29, 2007 Business Wire



AmerenUE Power Plant's Concrete Packaging Plant Wins Waste Management Award



The Missouri Waste Control Coalition today presented AmerenUE with an Outstanding Achievement Award for the AmerenUE/Charah(R), Inc. concrete packaging facility at Labadie Power Plant.     The Missouri Waste Control Coalition is a 400-member not-for-profit organization for citizens, businesses and organizations concerned about the environment and the proper management and disposal of generated ...
